metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9636 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the flx_decode_delta_fli function in gst/flx/gstflxdec.c in the FLIC decoder in GStreamer before 1.10.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) by providing a 'write count' that goes beyond the initialized buffer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9636` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gstreamer0.10-gconf - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.1
gstreamer0.10-plugins-good - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.1
gstreamer0.10-pulseaudio - 0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

gstreamer1.0-plugins-good - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1
gstreamer1.0-pulseaudio - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1
libgstreamer-plugins-good1.0-0 - 1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gst-plugins-good0.10 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.10.31-3+nmu1ubuntu5.1').
gst-plugins-good1.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.4-1~ubuntu1.1').
